detailsOfAchievement: education The importance of an education is not a simple to define. In simple language education is considered basics to ones life like food and shelter. If we think food is for our health and shelters for the body, so for that education is a food for our mind. Education gives us knowledge and knowledge is our power to survive in right way. Also an educated person could choose the use of knowledge and power for the benefit of themselves. It is says that education makes man a right thinker and it tells man how to think and how to make a decision. Health Care As everyone know the important of health care in our day-to-day life and everyone want take care his/her health properly to get relief from disease. But in Jumma areas about 6.3 million people are living under the crisis of health care facilities because perhaps you may know that the jumma area is the hilly area and it is situated north eastern part of India. The area is totally backward due to poor and hilly; also they are not getting proper sanitation facilities which are very essential for daily life. Legal aid The term legal aid refers to provide free legal assistance in essentially need to people. Legal aid is regarded as central in providing access to justice by ensuring equality before the law, the right to counsel and the right to a fair trial. Also legal aid provides access to justice for people who live in poverty. Women empowerment As you see in jumma areas most of the women are illiterate and dont have knowledge of women empowerment that Women empowerment is very important in a society and the participation of women in development field is one of the major development goals has become an important ideal in lot of development policy and theory. Also the womens empowerment can bring a perfect balance between the masculine and the feminine gender and establish gender equality based on creative and generative accomplishment in society which is based on the principles of love, sympathy, development and kindness. Developing gender equality Gender equality is the calculable equal sign of men and women and its mean that men and women should enjoy the same rights and opportunities across all sectors of society, including economic participation and any type of decision-making, they present different type of behaviors, aspirations and needs of men and women are equally valued and favoured. The importance of gender equality is highlighted by its inclusion as one of the major development goals that is serving as a framework for halving poverty and improving people lives. The inequality discrimination between genders such as gender-based violence, economic discrimination, reproductive health inequities, harmful tradition practices etc.

address: Centre for Human Genetics Biotech Park, Electronics City Phase 1 Bangalore 560100
title: Centre for Human Genetics
detailsOfAchievement: The Centre for Human Genetics is a centre for research, education and training in areas which lie at the interface of modern genetics and medicine. Besides research and teaching, the Centre provides comprehensive clinical services for a range of genetic disorders and inborn errors of metabolism. During the past few years the Centres scientists and clinical geneticists have provided diagnostic and counselling services to over 15,000 families with genetic disorders. With generous assistance from the Government of Karnataka, the Centre provides these services free of cost to BPL families seen at the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Health and other government-funded hospitals. The Centre conducts intensive short-term courses and training programmes in human disease genetics which routinely attract young scientists and clinicians from across the country. The Centre has been assisting medical colleges in several district headquarters in Karnataka to set up their own basic facilities for diagnosis and management of the more common genetic disorders. The Centres scientists are also engaged in developing low-cost strategies for diagnosis and therapy suitable for local requirements. Under its Public Engagement with Genetics programme, CHG provides assistance to parent support groups for families with genetic disorders. CHG is involved in improving public awareness of the ethical, legal and societal issues surrounding advances in human genome research. The Centre is located in a 20-acre institutional area within a 80-acre Biotech Park being developed by the Government of Karnataka in Electronics City in south Bangalore. IBAB, an institution specializing in Bioinformatics, and a Bio-IT Centre promoted jointly by the Ministry of IT, Government of India and the Government of Karnataka are next door. The Centre for Human Genetics is an academic partner in the Bio-IT Centre, which is equipped with NGS platforms. BBC, the Bangalore Bioinnovation Centre, is located behind CHGs laboratories. There are two health universities and several major hospitals in south Bangalore, among them NIMHANS, St. Johns and the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Heath. There is also a Health City coming up nearby, which includes Narayana Hrudayalaya and the new Mazumdar-Shaw Cancer Center. CHGs present location therefore provides obvious advantages for postgraduate teaching and research in Human Genetics. A post-doctoral Fellowship programme in Paediatric Genetics is being conducted by the Centre in collaboration with the Indira Gandhi Institute of Child Health. The Centre offers a two-year Masters degree programme in Human Disease Genetics under the aegis of Mysore University. The latter is a blend of formal teaching, laboratory exercises, case studies and activity-based learning. It provides hands-on training in human genetics via a combination of cell and molecular biology, genetics and clinical biology, including the use of statistical techniques. This interdisciplinary course has been designed to bridge the gap between clinical and basic biology.

detailsOfAchievement: The activities of CNBRCD concentrate mainly on natural biological resources, especially microbial inoculants. It is very well known that the use of heavy dose of fertilizers and pesticides is hazardous to soil, animal and human health. Hence, use of biologicals in place of chemicals is recommended in sustainable agriculture. The outstanding work on beneficial microorganisms, especially arbuscular mycorrhizal fungi (AMF) carried out at CNBRCD is recognized nationally and internationally. Earlier projects at CNBRCD brought out that 50 per cent of chemical fertilizers for crop plants can be reduced through microbial inoculation. Microbial inoculants also helped in raising quality seedlings in the nursery, revegetation of degraded forests and the biocontrol of soilborne plant pathogens. This in turn increased the income generation of the beneficiaries. The beneficiaries of the results of these research are marginal farmers especially women, schedule caste and tribal people. CNBRCD has developed protocols for the mass production of AMF by commercial entrepreneurs, as well as by farmers. CNBRCD which started in 2001 has completed 18 research projects funded mostly by GOI and has 3 ongoing projects now. It has published 109 research papers in national and international journals, 49 review articles and book chapters and 06 books related to microbiology. The trustees are actively involved as Reviewers of national and international research papers and research projects, Members of Editorial Board of several journals, Advisory and Expert Committee Members of several GOI funding agencies, Members of National Academies Science Academies Education Panel (thus taking science to students and young teachers) and Recipients of several national and international awards. For ex., the Chairman of CNBRCD is the only scientist from India invited by European Union to contribute to Global Soil Biodiversity Atlas released at Belgium in May 2016. So far 08 students have completed their Ph.D. and M.Phil. degree from CNBRCD and 3 are currently working for their Ph.D. degree. CNBRCD has trained a large number of scientists from India and other developing countries in methods used in AMF research. It is also maintaining the germplasm bank of AMF and supplies starter culture on request to students, scientist and farmers. Young scientists, extension workers and farmers were educated about the advantages in the use of ecofriendly microbial inoculants in place of chemicals like reduction in the cost of cultivation; reduction in environmental pollution and improvement in soil health. Though research on soil microorganisms is done in many laboratories in the country, rarely the benefit of the same reach the farmers. CNBRCD in addition to research has taken the results of research to the end user, the farmer. The work done at CNBRCD has brought beyond doubt that use of microbial inoculants can not only improve productivity in plants important in agriculture, horticulture and forestry but also reduce environmental pollution. CNBRCD is recognized as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (SIRO) by Department of Scientific and Industrial Research (DSIR-GOI) and has all the laboratory facilities, glass house and field facilities for carrying out the experiments.

detailsOfAchievement: Chaitanya Urban and Rural Development Sansthe Bailhongal CURDS a secular Non profit non political voluntary organisation was established and started working with Agricultural vulnerable rural poor people by organising and involving them in their development activities Chaitanya Urban and Rural Development Sansthe is a Non Government, Voluntary Social Service and Development Organization working among rural poor artisans in the field of integrated Rural Development in the most backward and interior, drought affected and agriculture dependent villages The range of programs implemented are Peoples participation and Community Development activities in different programs. It is also implementing Awareness Generation Programs on Educational & Socio-economic activities Agriculture, women Development, Health, Sanitation and Hygiene Education 1. Integrated Watershed Development Program IWMP in Hanagal Taluka of Haveri district under Watershed Department GOK Here, we are covering 12 villages of the taluka where in awareness generation SHG formation various trainings net planning in the farmers fields covering both women & men Education regarding the watershed program is given in depth so that the farmers themselves also can go for some income generation activities based on the resources available in their vicinity 2. HIV/AIDS awareness programs in Koppal & Belgaum districts of Karnataka. Migrants Targetted Intervention program in Koppal district and Link Worker Program in Belgaum district under Karnataka State AIDS Prevention Society(KSAPS), Bangalore. 3. Citizen Helpdesk program under KHSDRP of Health Dept GOK assisted by World Bank in Mandya district Hospital Mandya Thousands of people visit the district hospital were in they are given all the information regarding the hospital facilities & doctors availability Thus working as helpers to the poor patients to cure their diseases & get the maximum benefit out of the program 4. Awareness generation programme AGP under Central Social Welfare Board Delhi The program is conducted with aim of creating awareness in the community on issues relating to the status, rights and problems of women Its main objectives are to identify the needs of rural and poor women to increase their active participation in decision making both in the family and community on development issues including atrocities on women and children In turn these trained resource persons gave trainings to village communities covering 25 women from 5 villages The trainings were conducted in Devalapur of Bailhongal taluka of Belgaum district This program will help in over all awareness of women folk with all regards especially income generation activities 5. MOBILE HEALTH CLINIC program under KHSDRP of Health Dept of Karnataka Govt assisted by World Bank in Bailhongal Taluka of Belgaum district We are covering more than 20000 populations under this program It has a manpower of 6 members with a Doctor 2 nurses Pharmacist Attender & driver The main objective is to increase utilization of qualitative & measurable public & private health services particularly in underserved areas and amongst the vulnerable groups 6. Biodiversity programs in three districts namely Belgaum, Koppal and Haveri is being done presently. 7. The other programs conducted are 1 Dug well Recharge program in Gokak Taluk of Belgaum Dist GOK Under ZP supported by Central Govt 2 National Afforestation program in Gadag division of Gadag District under Forest Dept Of Karnataka Govt 3 AIDS & TB Awareness Program 4 Health Check-Up Camps 5 SHGs Formation & Training Program 6 Computer Training program 7Blood Donation Camp 8 Eye Operation Camp 9Women Awareness Program 9 Ground Water Recharge & Watershed Development Program 10 Organic Farming Awareness & Medicinal Plants Promotion Program 11Rain Water Harvesting Program 12 Prohibition of Drug Addiction Program 13 Tailoring Training Program 14 Vermiculture Training Program 15 Family Counseling Program 16 Legal Aid Program 17 Pulse Polio Program 18 Handicraft Training Program 19 Home Products Making Program & Papad Making Program 20 Gober Gas Awareness Program 21 Rural Sports 22 Safe Water Program 23 Sanitation Program 24 School Children Jatha 25 Screen Printing Training Program 26 Silk Reeling Program & Rope Making Program 27 Social Activities Program 28 Karnataka Rajyotsava 29Youth Activities Youth Education & Science Day Program etc The organisation has undertaken all its activities by following Participatory Methodology for promotion of Peoples Participation Development of Ownership Mentality Leadership quality and sustainability of the activities By adopting this methodology it has found its great success in every activity

title: Child Rights Trust
detailsOfAchievement: CRT is a resource organisaiton on child rights issues in Karnataka State. We are into research, capacity building, advocacy on child rights issues among general public, peoples representatives and media to monitor the situation of children and labour to protect the rights of children for survival, protection, development and participation. After a field based action research, CRT motivated Govt of Karnataka to declare Child Rights Grama Sabhas to be conducted every Nov. every year to take stock of the situation of children at Grama Panchayat level and to find solutions locally. After thorough study on the pattern of question raised on the floor of Vidhana Sabha and Parishath, CRT motivated legislators of Karnataka to develop Karnataka State Legislators Forum for Child Rights. CRT is providing information and motivation to the legislators to take up child centred issues to the Assembly and Council. These motivated the Karnataka Legislative Council to conduct Special Session on Child Rights in the year 2014. CRT is the Secretariat of Karnataka Child Rights Observatory (KCRO) and through this conducting Child Rights Parliament from district to state level and child representatives meet chief Minister in Nov. every year to raise their issues. This effort is supported by UNICEF. CRT is currently involved in promoting right to education awareness among the rural masses and preventing child marriages and child sexual abuse. CRT is the nodal agency for ChildLine 1098 for Bengaluru. CRT is conducting trainings to NGOs, media, Govt personnel, students and peoples representatives on various child rights issues, such as Juvenile Justice Act, RTE Act, Prohibition of Child Maririages Act, POCSO, National Policy for Children, etc., apart from the UN CRC. CRT works closely with the Govt of Karnataka in various advocacy and public education programmes to uphold the rights of children. We are also invited by the Govt and NGOs and VOs in various consultations related to child centered issues. Govt of Karnataka has recognized the works of CRT and has conferred Karnataka State Child Welfare Award in the year 2008.
